description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9htsf","text":"Silica gels are a biohybrid material for the encapsulation of cyanobacteria. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81di5","text":"Their internal structure is based on a highly porous three-dimensional SiO2 network with a mesoporous distribution of porosity, with a high number of micropores and mesopores. The cells are \"encapsulated\" in the material as they are embedded in the matrix, establishing almost direct contact with it. There is a reduced space between the cell and the silica matrix, favouring contact.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pek6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8fbu","text":"Macroscopically, the material can be presented in almost any desired shape and structure, ideally as thin films or hollow tubular monoliths of reduced thickness. Visually, it appears to be a rigid, greenish-coloured material. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3rq0","text":"The gels allow a low diffusional limit, its transparency allows cells to photosynthesise, and it is tough. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h3mo","text":"Their synthesis is not simple, as the behaviour of the gels can be variable; but in the end they form an almost ideal encapsulation for cyanobacteria. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7je3n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egc29","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"90muf","text":"Sodium silicate 37%","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bata","text":"Destilled water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9t0b","text":"KOH 0,2 M","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fop79","text":"HCl 0,1 M","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r348","text":"Amberlyst resine","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kd5e","text":"EtOH","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8tv8","text":"Fresh Cyanobacterial Culture","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7doru","text":"LUDOX® TMA colloidal silicaSigma AldrichCatalog #42085","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4to3t","text":"BG-11 Media (HEPES 10 mM pH = 8)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f31od","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33il5","text":"Beakers ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9fpm","text":"Exchange column ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3quct","text":"Cotton ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gv1j","text":"Micropipette","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i3aq","text":"Petri dish ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9giu1","text":"Falcon ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lc4u","text":"Flow bell","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek43n","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6q5ai","text":"Starting from   commercial sodium silicate, a dilution solution of   sodium silicate is prepared.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"athgn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42sub","text":"Volume of Na2SiO3 commercial x Percentage of Na2SiO3 commercial = Volume of Na2SiO3 solution x 5% ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak858","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nkum","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"doqt3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"37","error_concentration":false,"guid":"1B7001402F7F11EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"225B8CE02F7F11EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"avibi","text":"As far as possible, work in sterility, in a flow hood.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"937ca","text":"Cool the solution to about 4°C for at least one day in the refrigerator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nq03","text":"The ion exchange column is then prepared. For this purpose, a piece of cotton wool is placed at the bottom of the exchange column. Amberlyst resin is added on top of it until a height of about 10 cm is reached. To pack the column and allow it to exchange ions,   HCl is added. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":261,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agppo","text":"It is then washed with distilled water to remove as many Cl ions as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk413","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"uqhi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"11B708502F8011EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9boiu","text":"A beaker is placed under the column (placed on a stand with tongs) so that the liquid passing through the column can be collected.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ci46o","text":"Finally, gelled the columnn as much as possible with some ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej2u5","text":"Then, you can start exchanging. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cj9h4","text":"Add the sodium silicate at   to the column and wait until all the silicate has passed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b36f9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bt8b0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e618f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98lpo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9c3ip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"BF9093E02F8211EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2fajr","text":"It can last a few minutes, if all goes well. But, sometimes there are some problems as a gelation inside the column. If this occur, It is only necessary to wash the column and re-add the HCl.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":131}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e9ems","text":"It is important to place a plate of ice under the beaker in which the precursor is collected; try to keep the temperature at about  .","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fbjj0","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8858B9602F8311EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"5","unit":10},"mutability":"","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dipm8","text":"Add LUDOX with a micropipette:   of silicate x 1,39 g/ml (density of silicate) x 0,0375 (percentage) : 1,23 g/ml (LUDOX density) . IMP: before add the LUDOX, the botle has been sterilized ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aop6c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"002006102F8411EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"339j1","text":"Measure the OD of the cyano culture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f8a1","text":"Then, Disinfect and sterilize all the materials that gonna be necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgerf","text":"30 ml of culture (OD 0,441) have been caught and then have put into a centrifuge Falcon. (2/3 of the tube)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90urc","text":"Take an other Falcon and add water into it (30 ml) to have the same amount in both Falcon. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bm701","text":"Having the pellet after centrifugation, add   of BG-11 in order to resuspend it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cigt0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"597AC7902F8411EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3idsv","text":"With the cells, precursor and LUDOX in a Falcon,   KOH is added. The amount to be added depends on the pH. Measure with pH paper without being too intrusive with the cells. Add KOH until a pH of 8 is achieved, which is ideal for cyanobacteria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1evr2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.2","error_concentration":false,"guid":"BCC1F8A02F8411EC9E384578323E0EB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdh5s","text":"Quickly deposit the mixture in a Petri dish. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cms6","text":"Allow the gel to form.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"307n4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7nn8d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9p9au","text":"An alternative to accelerate gel formation is to apply heat, with caution and bearing in mind that the cells cannot withstand very high temperatures.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7pm1","text":"Finally, once the gel is formed, it is introduced into BG-11.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Cyanobacterial Encapsulation In Biocompatible Silica Gels
